description.narrative: By supporting the CHF, Sida will contribute to the implementation of around 10% of the HRP, which aims at saving lives and reducing suffering and vulnerability of populations affected by humanitarian crises in the DRC. Sida will contribute assisting and protecting around 5.2 million persons in DRC during 2015 who are affected by armed violence and conflicts, epidemics, malnutrition and natural disasters through a broad scope of response including health, water, sanitation and hygiene, food, non-food items, cash vouchers, shelter, education and protection. The CHF aims to strengthen coordination and increase the extent to which funding is allocated to priority humanitarian needs. The CHF enhances the ability of the HC to direct funds to strategic humanitarian priorities.

Den humanitära fonden är en av de huvudsakliga finansieringsmekanismerna för humanitär verksamhet i DR Kongo, drygt 10% av den totala humanitära finansieringen går igenom den. CHF finansierar i huvudsak tre olika delar av det humanitära systemet. 1) Medel allokeras en eller två gånger per år för den humanitära respons som det humanitära nätverket på plats formulerar och ansöker om. Det tillåter organisationer att söka medel för långtgående respons med förebyggande och kapacitetsstärkande inslag. 2) CHF finansierar också en del kringservice som den humanitära responsen är beroende av (t.ex. logistik och flygtransporter). 3) CHF:en finansierar snabba akuta insatser. Fonden administreras gemensamt av UNDP och OCHA. UNDP:s MultiPartner Trust Fund kontor i New York tar emot och kanaliserar medel vidare till andra FN organ, samt till UNDP för vidareförmedling till NGO's. OCHA administrerar det löpande strategiska arbetet inom Joint Pool Fund Unit (JPFU), den UNDP/OCHA gemensamma enhet som planerar och följer upp insatserna.
Den humanitära koordinatorn, utsedd av OCHA, har ett huvudansvar att koordinera den nationella humanitära responsen och representerar det humanitära nätverket gentemot den kongolesiska regeringen, givarna och FN:s fredsbevarande mission. Den humanitära koordinatorn har också en central roll i humanitärt påverkansarbete och sitter som ordförande i CHF styrelse. Fonden utgör ett av den humanitära koordinatorns verktyg och syftar till att stärka en snabb och effektiv, välkoordinerad humanitär verksamhet, och är helt i linje med den humanitära reformprocessen. Fonden har det senaste året utvecklats till att bli ett mer effektivt finansieringsverktyg för att stödja akuta humanitära insatser, liksom förebyggande insatser. Fonden baserar sig på den av det humanitära samfundet i DR Kongo utarbetade humanitära planen (Humanitarian Response Plan, HRP), ett verktyg som på årlig basis identifierar behov och prioriteringar för humanitär verksamhet i landet. Sedan 1994 har gemensamma humanitära strategier och appeller lanserats i DRK.
DRC var ett av de första länder som lanserat humanitära appeller – över 15 årliga humanitära appeller har lanserats sedan år 2000, vilket ger en bild av den kroniska dimensionen av krisen. Därav syftar detta beslut – att bidra med utvecklingsmeden till den humanitära fonden - till förebyggande åtgärder. Detta för att förhindra de cykliska humanitära effekter som årligen uppstår i utsatta geografiska områden, såsom Katanga. Tex blir 2015 det femte året då en stor del av humanitära medel från CHFen går till kolera responsen i Katanga. Detta urholkar CHFens humanitära resurser. Genom förebyggande åtgärden inom vatten och sanitet kan kolera epidemin begränsas, liv räddas och humanitära resursen besparas.
Denna insats är i enlighet med DRCs landstrategi och landets HRP. Båda dokument betonar vikten av att förebygga kriser, förstärka samhällens motkraft gentemot kroniska humanitära behov samt att understödja hållbart återhämtning för internflyktingar.

The humanitarian fund is one of the main funding mechanisms for humanitarian activities in DR Congo, just over 10% of the total humanitarian funding goes through it. The CHF is funding essentially three different parts of the humanitarian system in DRC. Once or twice a year it allocates resources to projects in line with the HRP. Organizations may apply for funding for longer term response with prevention and capacity strengthening components. It supports enhancing services that ensure access (UNHAS) and needs assessments (RRMP). The fund is administered jointly by UNDP and OCHA. UNDP Multi-Partner Trust Fund Office in New York, receiving and channeling funds to other UN bodies, as well as to UNDP, for dissemination to the NGO's. OCHA manages the ongoing strategic work within the Joint Pool Fund Unit (JPFU), the UNDP / OCHA joint unit plan and follow up interventions.
The Humanitarian Coordinator, appointed by OCHA, has a primary responsibility to coordinate the national humanitarian response and represents the humanitarian network against the Congolese Government, donors and the UN peacekeeping mission. Sida proposes to take this decision, in complement to its humanitarian funding decision to the CHF in DRC for 2015 (61.2 MSEK) based on this assessment common to both decisions, and to contribute with 49 million Swedish Crowns to the CHF during 2015-2016 (24.5 MSEK per year) out of its development appropriation for DRC to support resilience building activities in humanitarian projects that will have access to funding through the CHF's standard allocations.
Sida has been comforted in its initiative by the consensual conclusion of the CHF Advisory Board, during its meeting on 10 June 2015, that community resilience is already mainstreamed in CHF standard allocations and should continue as a best practice of the humanitarian system in DRC likely to reduce chronic vulnerabilities and risks of disasters.

description.narrative: In addition to above, the objective of the intervention has been to strengthen the function of the humanitarian pooled fund (hereafter "the fund") as a tool for resilience interventions in the border area between humanitarian recovery and early development. This is in correspondence with the humanitarian and development context of the DRC, where development and humanitarian needs often are coinciding and often not possible to clearly distinguish from one another. The support to the fund for resilience purposes has been a pilot project, allowing long term development cooperation funding from Sweden's bilateral country frame for the DRC to be channeled through a humanitarian recovery instrument. This has been done through the standard allocation modality of the fund to projects with up to 24 months implementation period, supporting beneficiaries' recovery and resilience among communities affected by humanitarian crises in different parts of DRC. These longer-term interventions add to shorter term interventions through emergency allocations and standard allocations for projects of shorter durations, funded through humanitarian funding from Sweden and other donors. The fund during this time has been be the single most important instrument of Sweden's support both humanitarian recovery and also resilience building, in the DRC. The objective of the contribution is continuously achieved through the interventions of the fund through the year and different locations of humanitarian crises in the DRC. 2015 and 2016 saw a decline in incoming funding to the CBPF. The embassy has made significant efforts to help promote the CBPF as an important instrument for humanitarian assistance in the wider donor community. Sweden has during the period been the 2nd biggest contributor to the fund after the UK. The monitoring and follow up function of the fund has been overall well organized and effective, although sometimes insufficient with regard to the high number of running projects and as well as the broad thematic and geographic scope of the DRC fund. The fund has been treating a few cases of suspected irregularities, both internal and partner-related, in accordance with existing regulations and routines. The embassy's impression is that quality, transparency and adequacy in the handling of those matters has been overall satisfactory. The project is an amendment to a framework agreement between Sweden and the UNDP and regards support for the humanitarian fund (CBPF) in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) 2015 and 2016. The framework agreement will remain validwhile the contribution now to be closed has been replaced by another project in support of the CBPF in DRC (Sida contribution 51250032, UM/2017/17236/KINS), through an amendment to the same framework agreement. All reports and documentation stipulated by the contribution agreement and Sida project management routines have been added to the file and approved by the embassy, when applicable.
